ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: We engaged with many postmodern pieces as viewers and dancers (spending a lot of time especially on Trisha Brown's work), and spent the latter half of the semester in something of a choreographic laboratory. Definitely made me a better dancer and choreographer.

I learned how to truly take the environment around me and let that inspire my interpretation and presentation of myself as well what is going on around me and the small details and beauty in the world around around me. Professor Irene helped to foster an environment that felt like a truly safe place to create new ways to understand myself, my art, those around me, and the environments around me.
The choreogrpahic techniques of Trisha Brown, Moriah Evans, Rashaun Mitchell and Silas Riener, and more; intersection of dance and architecture; improvisation and freedom in movement
A fantastic course.  I learned to connect with my body and get outside my brain in very meaningful ways.  A wonderful class community filled with passion and acceptance!  Couldn't ask for more.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Irene!!! This woman is an absolute joy to dance with; she makes every class lighthearted, fun, and different. Nothing but positive things to say about her.

The strengths of this course are the facts that it is a very emotional and deep connecting class that really requires that you give yourself to the teachings, and it is quite immersive which is lovely. Its other strength is the professor because she fostered the perfect balance of work as well as caring compromise that made the class engaging but not overly stressful.
Great class -- the pacing was good and divided nicely between learning choreography, improving, and creating our own pieces

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes! great movement class, lots of learning and growth, Irene is a wonderful instructor

Absolutely!! If you're looking for a chill three hours of movement per week, this is the course for you. It flexes totally different muscles than most other Yale courses. A creative and kinesthetic mode of learning!

I would suggest this course to other students because it fosters a great community, but it also really does help you to develop a new point of view if you really immerse yourself and engage with the guests and choreography. There are a lot of readings and videos to watch though, so be aware of that, though your level of engagement with that is pretty much up to you.
Yes! Great class to explore movement within the body and how external features (architecture, sound, thought) affect it.
